meanings.definition: Somewhat raw in quality or nature.
meanings.sent1: The rawish vegetables tasted fresh and crunchy.
meanings.sent2: The chef preferred a rawish texture for the sushi rice.
meanings.sent3: The rawish steak was so undercooked, it mooed.
meanings.sent4: Her rawish talent in painting was like a blank canvas waiting to be filled.
meanings.sent5: The rawish smell of the ocean lingered in the air.

meanings.definition: Having a raw or uncooked appearance.
meanings.sent1: The rawish dough needed more time to bake.
meanings.sent2: The chicken had a rawish look, so she cooked it longer.
meanings.sent3: His rawish haircut made him look like a rockstar.
meanings.sent4: The rawish landscape of the desert was harsh and unforgiving.
meanings.sent5: The rawish color of the paint gave the room a rustic feel.

meanings.definition: In a raw or uncooked state.
meanings.sent1: The rawish fish was served with a zesty sauce.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't eat the rawish cookie dough fast enough.
meanings.sent3: The rawish egg cracked open, revealing a surprise inside.
meanings.sent4: His rawish emotions spilled out in a torrent of tears.
meanings.sent5: The rawish meat sizzled on the grill, sending up delicious aromas.
